data.name: Surskit
data.flavorText: It appears as if it is skating on water. It draws prey with a sweet scent from the tip of its head.

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Masquerain
data.flavorText: Its antennae have eye patterns on them. Its four wings enable it to hover and fly in any direction.

abilities.name: Tool Reversal
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may put a Pokémon Tool card attached to 1 of your Pokémon into your hand.

data.name: Lileep
data.flavorText: It lived on the seafloor 100 million years ago and was reanimated scientifically.
rules: Put this card onto your Bench only with the effect of Root Fossil Lileep

abilities.name: Prehistoric Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your discard pile, you may put this Pokémon on the bottom of your deck.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Cradily
data.flavorText: It lives in the shallows of warm seas. When the tide goes out, it digs up prey from beaches.

attacks.name: Lifesplosion
attacks.text: For each Energy attached to this Pokémon, search your deck for a Stage 2 Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Shelmet
data.flavorText: When it and Karrablast are together, and both receive electrical stimulation, they both evolve.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Tropius
data.flavorText: It flies by flapping its broad leaves and gives the sweet, delicious fruit around its neck to children.

attacks.name: Return
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Energy Press
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Karrablast
data.flavorText: For some reason they evolve when they receive electrical energy while they are attacking Shelmet.

data.name: Accelgor
data.flavorText: When its body dries out, it weakens. So it wraps a membrane around itself for protection while it spits poison.

attacks.name: Retribution
attacks.text: If an Escavalier you had in play was Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, put all Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon into your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Signal Beam
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Genesect
data.flavorText: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 Grass Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Jet Impact
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Virizion-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Verdant Wind
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon that has any Grass Energy attached to it can't be affected by any Special Conditions. (Remove any Special Conditions affecting those Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Emerald Slash
attacks.text: You may search your deck for 2 Grass Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Genesect-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Red Signal
abilities.text: When you attach a Plasma Energy from your hand to this Pokémon, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Megalo Cannon
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Larvesta
data.flavorText: Said to have been born from the sun, it spews fire from its horns and encases itself in a cocoon of fire when it evolves.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Volcarona
data.flavorText: Thought to be an embodiment of the sun, it appeared during a bitterly cold winter and saved Pokémon from freezing.

attacks.name: Solar Transporter
attacks.text: Reveal the top 5 cards of your deck and put all Team Plasma cards you find there into your hand. Discard the other cards.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Squirtle
data.flavorText: It shelters itself in its shell then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Wartortle
data.flavorText: It is said to live 10,000 years. Its furry tail is popular as a symbol of longevity.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Blastoise
data.flavorText: The jets of water it spouts from the rocket cannons on its shell can punch through thick steel.

abilities.name: Deluge
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Water Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Remoraid
data.flavorText: The water they shoot from their mouths can hit moving prey from more than 300 feet away.

attacks.name: Bubble Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Lapras
data.flavorText: Able to understand human speech and very intelligent, it loves to swim in the sea with people on its back.

attacks.name: Cleanse Away
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Octillery
data.flavorText: It has a tendency to want to be in holes. It prefers rock crags or pots and sprays ink from them before attacking.

attacks.name: Sharpshooting
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Bubble Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Suicune
data.flavorText: It races around the world to purify fouled water. It dashes away with the north wind.

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by Pokémon-EX.

data.name: Snorunt
data.flavorText: It is said that several Snorunt gather under giant leaves and live together in harmony.

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Glalie
data.flavorText: It prevents prey from escaping by instantaneously freezing moisture in the air.

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Reflect Energy
attacks.text: Move a Water Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Froslass
data.flavorText: It freezes prey by blowing its -58 degrees F breath. It is said to then secretly display its prey.

abilities.name: Cursed Glare
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't attach any Special Energy cards from his or her hand to his or her Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Snover
data.flavorText: Seemingly curious about people, they gather around footsteps they find on snowy mountains.

data.name: Abomasnow
data.flavorText: They appear when the snow flowers bloom. When the petals fall, they retreat to places unknown again.

attacks.name: Bang Heads
attacks.text: Both this Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon are now Confused.

data.name: Relicanth
data.flavorText: A rare Pokémon discovered during a deep-sea exploration. It has not changed in over 100 million years.

attacks.name: Fossil Hunt
attacks.text: Put 2 Item cards that have Fossil in their names from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Tirtouga
data.flavorText: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. It swam skillfully and dove to depths beyond half a mile.
rules: Put this card onto your Bench only with the effect of Cover Fossil

abilities.name: Prehistoric Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your discard pile, you may put this Pokémon on the bottom of your deck.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Tynamo
data.flavorText: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.

data.name: Ducklett
data.flavorText: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.

attacks.name: Splatter
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Carracosta
data.flavorText: It could knock out a foe with a slap from one of its developed front appendages and chew it up, shell or bones and all.

attacks.name: Fossil Clutch
attacks.text: You may discard an Item card that has Fossil in its name from your hand. If you do, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.name: Kyurem-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Giga Frost
attacks.text: Discard 2 Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Eelektrik
data.flavorText: It wraps itself around its prey and paralyzes it with electricity from the round spots on its sides. Then it chomps.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Eelektross
data.flavorText: It latches on to prey with its sucker mouth, sinking in its fangs and shocking the prey with powerful electricity.

attacks.name: Crush and Burn
attacks.text: Discard as many Energy attached to your Pokémon as you like. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Energy cards you discarded.

attacks.name: Thunder Tempest
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Drifloon
data.flavorText: These Pokémon are called the "Signpost for Wandering Spirits." Children holding them sometimes vanish.

attacks.name: Creepy Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Wind Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Drifblim
data.flavorText: They carry people and Pokémon, but the wind can catch them, so there can't be a fixed destination.

abilities.name: Drifting Balloon
abilities.text: This Pokémon's attacks cost Colorless less for each of your opponent's Team Plasma Pokémon in play.

attacks.name: Derail
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Uxie
data.flavorText: When Uxie flew, people gained the ability to solve problems. It was the birth of knowledge.

attacks.name: Psypower
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Mesprit
data.flavorText: When Mesprit flew, people learned the joy and sadness of living. It was the birth of emotions.

abilities.name: Mental Shroud
abilities.text: If you have Uxie and Azelf in play, each of your Pokémon has no Weakness.

data.name: Munna
data.flavorText: This Pokémon appears before people and Pokémon who are having nightmares and eats those dreams.

attacks.name: Focused Wish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Azelf
data.flavorText: When Azelf flew, people gained the determination to do things. It was the birth of willpower.

attacks.name: Trading Places
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psyjamming
attacks.text: Move as many Special Energy attached to your opponent's Pokémon to your opponent's other Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Musharna
data.flavorText: The dream mist coming from its forehead changes into many different colors depending on the dream that was eaten.

attacks.name: Precognitive Dream
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards. This Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Sigilyph
data.flavorText: The guardians of an ancient city, they always fly the same route while keeping watch for invaders.

abilities.name: Toolbox
abilities.text: This Pokémon may have up to 4 Pokémon Tool cards attached to it. (If this Pokémon loses this Ability, discard Pokémon Tool cards attached to this Pokémon until only 1 Pokémon Tool card remains.)

data.name: Solosis
data.flavorText: Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they are fine in any environment, no matter how severe.

attacks.name: Hide
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Duosion
data.flavorText: When their two divided brains think the same thoughts, their psychic power is maximized.

attacks.name: Focused Wish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Reuniclus
data.flavorText: They use psychic power to control their arms, which are made of a special liquid. They can crush boulders psychically.

attacks.name: Barrier Attack
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Telekinesis of Nobility
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Golett
data.flavorText: Ancient science fashioned this Pokémon from clay. It's been active for thousands of years.

data.name: Golurk
data.flavorText: Golurk were created to protect people and Pokémon. They run on a mysterious energy.

attacks.name: Iron Fist of Justice
attacks.text: If you have any Team Plasma Pokémon in play, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Shadow Punch
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Machop
data.flavorText: Though small in stature, it is powerful enough to easily heft and throw a number of Geodude at once.

data.name: Machoke
data.flavorText: It happily carries heavy cargo to toughen up. It willingly does hard work for people.

attacks.name: Last-Chance Chop
attacks.text: If this Pokémon's remaining HP is 10, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Machamp
data.flavorText: Its four muscled arms slam foes with powerful punches and chops at blinding speed.

abilities.name: Badge of Discipline
abilities.text: The damage of each of your Fighting Pokémon's attacks isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Close Combat
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, during your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is increased by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Throh
data.flavorText: When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.

attacks.name: Freestyle Strike
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Shoulder Throw
attacks.text: Does 80 damage minus 20 damage for each Colorless in the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.name: Sawk
data.flavorText: Desiring the strongest karate chop, they seclude themselves in mountains and train without sleeping.

attacks.name: Kick of Righteousness
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Team Plasma Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Machamp
data.flavorText: Its four muscled arms slam foes with powerful punches and chops at blinding speed.

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Reinforced Lariat
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Archeops
data.flavorText: It runs better than it flies. It takes off into the sky by running at a speed of 25 mph.

attacks.name: Acrobatics
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Swift Dive
attacks.text: If this Pokémon's remaining HP is 50 or less, this attack's base damage is 50.

data.name: Archen
data.flavorText: It was revived from an ancient fossil. Not able to fly, it lived in treetops and hopped from one branch to another.
rules: Put this card onto your Bench only with the effect of Plume Fossil

abilities.name: Prehistoric Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your discard pile, you may put this Pokémon on the bottom of your deck.

data.name: Lairon
data.flavorText: Lairon fight over territory, and when their steel bodies collide, sparks fly.

attacks.name: Iron Head
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Aron
data.flavorText: In order to build up its steel body, it eats iron ore. This pesky Pokémon is known to eat railroad tracks.

attacks.name: Iron Head
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Aggron
data.flavorText: It claims an entire mountain as its own. The more wounds it has, the more it has battled, so don't take it lightly.

attacks.name: Knock Back
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aura of the Land
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Jirachi-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Stellar Guidance
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench, you may search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Hypnostrike
attacks.text: Both this Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon are now Asleep.

data.name: Houndoom
data.flavorText: The flames it breathes when angry contain toxins. If they cause a burn, it will hurt forever.

attacks.name: Dark Clamp
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Blazing Claws
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Team Plasma Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage, and the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Houndour
data.flavorText: It is smart enough to hunt in packs. It uses a variety of cries for communicating with others.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Salamence
data.flavorText: As a result of its long-held dream of flying, its cellular structure changed, and wings grew out.

abilities.name: Breakwing
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may discard all Pokémon Tool cards attached to each of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gaia Crush
attacks.text: Discard any Stadium card in play.

data.name: Escavalier
data.flavorText: Wearing the shell covering they stole from Shelmet, they defend themselves and attack with two lances.

attacks.name: Steamroll
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Slashing Strike during your next turn.

data.name: Bagon
data.flavorText: Dreaming of one day flying, it practices by leaping off cliffs every day.

data.name: Shelgon
data.flavorText: Within its rugged shell, its cells have begun changing. The shell peels off the instant it evolves.

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Dialga-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Reverse Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put a card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Fast Forward
attacks.text: For each Plasma Energy attached to this Pokémon, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Palkia-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Strafe
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dimension Heal
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon 20 damage for each Plasma Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Axew
data.flavorText: Its large tusks have a tendency to break, but each time they grow back, they grow in harder and sturdier.

attacks.name: Strong Bond
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card named Iris, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Fraxure
data.flavorText: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Druddigon
data.flavorText: It runs through the narrow tunnels formed by Excadrill and Onix. It uses its sharp claws to catch prey.

attacks.name: Big Swing
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Shred
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Haxorus
data.flavorText: Its tusks are incredibly destructive. They can easily slice through a thick, sturdy steel column every time.

attacks.name: Dragonaxe
attacks.text: Does 40 damage times the amount of Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Strike of the Champion
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Team Plasma Pokémon, it is Knocked Out. (If the Defending Pokémon is not a Team Plasma Pokémon, this attack does nothing.)

data.name: Kangaskhan
data.flavorText: It raises its offspring in its belly pouch. It lets the baby play only when it feels safe.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Comet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Porygon2
data.flavorText: It was upgraded to enable the exploration of other planets. However, it failed to measure up.

attacks.name: Destructive Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Porygon-Z
data.flavorText: Its programming was modified to enable work in alien dimensions. It did not work as planned.

abilities.name: Plasma Transfer
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Plasma Energy attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tri Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Teddiursa
data.flavorText: It lets honey soak into its paws so it can lick them all the time. Every set of paws tastes unique.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Porygon
data.flavorText: A man-made Pokémon created using advanced scientific means. It can move freely in cyberspace.

data.name: Chatot
data.flavorText: Its tongue is just like a human's. As a result, it can cleverly mimic human speech.

attacks.name: Misinformation
attacks.text: Discard all Pokémon Tool cards attached to each of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tone-Deaf
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Caitlin
rules: Put as many cards from your hand as you like on the bottom of your deck in any order. Then, draw a card for each card you put on the bottom of your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Ursaring
data.flavorText: In its territory, it leaves scratches on trees that bear delicious berries or fruits.

attacks.name: Adrenalash
attacks.text: During your next turn, each of this Pokémon's attacks does 50 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Cover Fossil
rules: Look at the bottom 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Tirtouga you find there and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Energy Retrieval
rules: Put 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Iris
rules: During this turn, your Pokémon's attacks do 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon for each Prize card your opponent has taken (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Plume Fossil
rules: Look at the bottom 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal an Archen you find there and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Pokémon Catcher
rules: Switch your opponent's Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Professor Juniper
rules: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Silver Bangle
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to (excluding Pokémon-EX) do 30 more damage to Active Pokémon-EX (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card on the Basic Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Basic Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Reversal Trigger
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
When the Team Plasma Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Root Fossil Lileep
rules: Look at the bottom 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Lileep you find there and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Silver Mirror
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to the Pokémon this card is attached to (excluding Pokémon-EX) by your opponent's Team Plasma Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Ultra Ball
rules: Discard 2 cards from your hand. (If you can't discard 2 cards, you can't play this card.) Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Plasma Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.

data.name: G Booster
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Genesect-EX this card is attached to can also use the attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

attacks.name: G Booster
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: G Scope
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Genesect-EX this card is attached to can also use the attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

attacks.name: G Scope
attacks.text: This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Master Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

data.name: Scoop Up Cyclone
rules: Put 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

data.name: Genesect-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Red Signal
abilities.text: When you attach a Plasma Energy from your hand to this Pokémon, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Megalo Cannon
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Stellar Guidance

attacks.name: Hypnostrike

rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Verdant Wind

attacks.name: Emerald Slash
attacks.text: You may search your deck for 2 Grass Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Iris
rules: During this turn, your Pokémon's attacks do 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon for each Prize card your opponent has taken (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Reverse Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put a card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Fast Forward
attacks.text: For each Plasma Energy attached to this Pokémon, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Palkia-EX

abilities.name: Sinister Hand
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Double Draw

attacks.name: Leaf Wallop

data.name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card on the Basic Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Basic Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
